summary:
I’m a freelancing data visualization designer and artist, working from a tiny town near Amsterdam, with a background in data science & a graduated Astronomer. 

I work to captivate and engage an audience with the insights that the data reveals. To convince them of the lessons hidden within the numbers. To take readers along on a journey told through the lens of data.

In 2016 I was chosen as Rising Star and in 2017 I became Best Individual in the Kantar Information is Beautiful Awards. I’ve worked with small start-ups, magazines like Scientific American, all the way to global multinationals such as Google to help them get the most out of their data. And this can be done through both static or interactive visualizations, for online or print. So long as there’s data that has a story to reveal.

For each project I design my visualizations completely custom build. Starting from the actual data & goals, not the “available charts”. Resulting in engaging, beautiful and effective visualizations of your data. And taking the creativity one step further, I also love to turn numbers into data art or branding material, since your company’s data is inherently unique. Something that entices the eye first and foremost while still hinting at patterns found in the data.

I can take on the entire data visualization process. From data analysis, to design, to creating the final stand-alone piece. But I can also focus only on the design of the visualization an afterwards act as an advisor to your own front-end developers or analysts. Get in touch to discuss what works best for you! And please, if you'd like to get in touch, email me at info @ visualcinnamon.com, I often forget about LinkedIn.

(PS I only accept people on LinkedIn that I know, if you want to stay up to date with my posts, follow me instead! :) )

I create static designs for the different reports, dashboards and all other facets that are improved through the visualization of data (such as an organogram). I build almost all my final fully-fledged visualization with d3.js, but I also work with tools such as Sketch, Adobe Illustrator and R for the design and data preparation phase.

Steps that are typically involved in creating a new data visualization or dashboard are:

    • Get an understanding of the goal by talking to the customer/users
        • What questions should the users be able to answers with the dashboard?
    • Investigate the data that is needed and that which is available for the dashboard
    • Design rough sketches of the dashboard, always try to think om more than 1 way
    • Select the best ideas and create a static (or simple browser based) version of the dashboard
    • Run your design(s) by the users to get feedback
    • Work towards a final design that can then be build either by myself or team members', 'title': 'Data Visualization Designer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1038, 'name': 'Deloitte Nederland', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGNtpblgQpJoQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1662120927694?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=msOWLAa65UuFiPVJqKLR9pZkVQMUJYJuDRwepS-bd5U', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/deloitte/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Deloitte', 'description': "As a Senior Consultant at Deloitte's service line of Business Intelligence and Analytics I worked as a Data Scientist & Data visualization specialist. 

In the field of Analytics I have experience with customer segmentation, association analysis, text mining and retention modelling in retail, banking, insurance and consumer business. During my time at Deloitte I have become mostly specialized in Customer Analytics

I was responsible for all tasks associated with data manipulation and analytical applications in projects to find insights in client data. My main tasks included:
    • Converting business questions into an analytical roadmap of tasks to perform
    • Gathering intelligence about data availability and constructing a data model
    • Cleaning, enriching and joining client data to prepare it for modelling (R, SAS, SQL)
    • Analyzing data using either statistical software or self-written algorithms (R)
    • Visualizing results in graphs or custom made interactive designs (R, D3.js, JS, Adobe CC)
    • Transforming the insights into strategic next steps

In the last year at Deloitte I focused on advanced data visualization (not dashboards). Creating custom made visuals of client data or content for publications. I also helped other teams improve on their charts to generate a more lasting impact and make them more effective. For my own work I often use a combination of D3.js (and other JavaScript libraries), R and Illustrator.", 'title': 'Senior Consultant Advanced Analytics & Data Visualization', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 6077, 'name': 'Leiden University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEFlK1wNecYbA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855876129?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=_Ka1xca3IfdCHmeD7q7WGgDYObpZ56ZjJTvjnjfwxW0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/leiden-university/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Leiden University', 'description': 'Tutoring first year undergraduate astronomy students.
